pageTitle: Prime Minister’s itinerary for Thursday, February 3, 2022 | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Note: All times local

National Capital Region, Canada

Private meetings

11:00 a.m. The Prime Minister will make an early learning and child care announcement virtually with Premier of Manitoba Heather Stefanson, Minister of Families, Children and Social Development Karina Gould, and Minister responsible for Prairies Economic Development Canada Dan Vandal. A media availability will follow.

The event will be streamed live on the Government of Manitoba’s YouTube channel:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Vt07Ajbk8g4

Notes for media:

  • Journalists can ask questions by logging in via the following link:
    https://us06web.zoom.us/j/87660293474?pwd=WVM0bjNvdzRMYlJlRDhpTW0rVlVZQT09
    • Meeting ID: 876 6029 3474
    • Passcode: 786576
  • Journalists are asked to log in 15 minutes prior to the start of the event.

1:30 p.m. The Prime Minister will participate in a roundtable with Winnipeg teachers about their experience as educators during the pandemic. He will be joined by Member of Parliament for Winnipeg North Kevin Lamoureux, Parliamentary Secretary to the Minister of Environment and Climate Change Terry Duguid, and Minister responsible for Prairies Economic Development Canada Dan Vandal.

Closed to media

3:00 p.m. The Prime Minister will virtually visit Country Corner Donuts, a local shop in Regina, Saskatchewan.

Closed to media
